thread.title: Deadpool Was the Most Pirated Movie of 2016 - Report - GameSpot
thread.title_full: Deadpool Was the Most Pirated Movie of 2016 - Report - GameSpot

title: Deadpool Was the Most Pirated Movie of 2016 - Report - GameSpot
text:
Deadpool Was the Most Pirated Movie of 2016 - Report Batman v Superman, Captain America: Civil War, and The Force Awakens also made the list. Last updated by Eddie Makuch on January 2, 2017 Want the latest gaming news as it breaks? All the highlights in the world of games, lovingly delivered 2-3 times/week. You're Good to Go! You are now subscribed Subscribe for the latest gaming news 
According to TorrentFreak , the R-rated smash hit Deadpool was pirated more than any other movie in 2016. That's one record the film might have hoped to avoid. 
Released in February 2016, Deadpool made a massive $783 million at the worldwide box office against a budget of just $58 million, according to Box Office Mojo . A sequel of course is on the way. 
"While file-sharers may have a slight preference for geeky films, in general there's a high correlation between piracy and box-office sales," TorrentFreak reported ( via Entertainment Weekly ). 
Rounding out the top five in the site's list were Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice , Captain America: Civil War , Star Wars: The Force Awakens , and X-Men Apocalypse . 
TorrentFreak's list is based on a number of sources, including statistics that come from public BitTorrent trackers. Here is the full Top 10 list. Most Pirated Movies on BitTorrent in 2016: Deadpool Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice Captain America: Civil War Star Wars: The Force Awakens X-Men Apocalypse
